start.speaker: Pixel
start.text: Hey there! I'm Pixel, your game-making buddy! Ready to cook up something awesome? 🎮

guidedExperience.speaker: Pixel
guidedExperience.text: Not for long! Check out the WYSIWYG editor - it's like building with digital LEGOs! You drag stuff, I write the code. Magic!

options.text: I'm ready, let me at it!

guidedTour.speaker: Pixel
guidedTour.text: Smart move! Let me give you the quick tour - it'll save you time, trust me!
guidedTour.followUp: Think of it like this: left side is your toy box, middle is your playground, right side is where you tweak stuff.
guidedTour.additionalText: Pro tip: Start with a character sprite, then add some platforms. Everything you drop becomes instant Python code. It's honestly kind of mesmerizing to watch!

gamePath.speaker: Pixel
gamePath.text: Alright, time for the fun part! What kind of game is bouncing around in your head right now?

options.text: Something with swords and magic and epic quests!
Ooh, dark dungeons and treasure hunting
SPEED! I want to go fast!
A story-driven adventure would be cool

workStyle.speaker: Pixel
workStyle.text: Nice choice! Now, quick question - how do you want to approach this?

options.text: I'll dive right in - just show me the tools!
Walk me through it - I learn best with guidance

guidedStart.speaker: Pixel
guidedStart.text: Perfect! I'll guide you through building your complete game step by step. We'll create three essential parts: a title screen to welcome players, the main gameplay, and an ending screen.
guidedStart.followUp: Let's start with your title screen - it's the first thing players see, so we'll make it pop! Ready?

gameType.platformer: Here's an energetic title screen for your platformer! Big bouncy letters, your character doing a jump animation, and a pulsing 'Press Start' button. The background has floating platforms to hint at the gameplay!
gameType.rpg: Behold! An epic fantasy title screen! Scrolling parchment texture, golden medieval font, your hero's silhouette against a dramatic sunset, and mystical particle effects. Very quest-worthy!
gameType.dungeon: Dark and atmospheric! Stone wall texture, torches with flickering flame effects, the title etched in ancient stone, and a mysterious dungeon entrance looming in the background!
gameType.racing: SPEED AND CHROME! Metallic letters with motion blur effects, checkered flag patterns, a sleek vehicle revving with exhaust particles, and speedometer graphics. Pure adrenaline!
gameType.puzzle: Clean and clever! Geometric patterns animating in the background, crisp modern typography, puzzle pieces that slide together to form the title. Smart and inviting!
gameType.adventure: Cinematic beauty! A sweeping landscape panorama, title that fades in with dramatic timing, subtle ambient particles floating by, and adventure gear scattered around the edges!
gameType.default: A classic game title! Bold colorful letters with a subtle animation, inviting 'Start' button, and atmospheric background. Simple but effective!

guidedGameplay.speaker: Pixel
guidedGameplay.text: Excellent! Now for the heart of your game - the actual gameplay! I've prepared everything you need.

gameType.platformer: Your hero can run with arrow keys, jump with spacebar, and collect shiny coins! I've added moving platforms, spiky obstacles to avoid, and power-ups that make you jump higher. Try it out!
gameType.rpg: Your adventurer moves with WASD, interacts with E, and battles with the mouse! I've added a village to explore, friendly NPCs with quests, enemies to fight, and treasure chests to discover!
gameType.dungeon: Navigate with arrow keys through procedurally generated rooms! I've added torch lighting that follows you, traps that activate when you're near, monsters lurking in shadows, and glittering treasure to collect!
gameType.racing: Full throttle action! Up arrow accelerates, down brakes, left/right to steer! I've added a twisting track with corners, speed boosts on straightaways, a lap timer, and rival cars to race against!
gameType.puzzle: Click and drag to interact! I've set up a satisfying match-3 grid where pieces fall naturally, combos trigger cascades, points rack up with multipliers, and special pieces clear whole rows!
gameType.adventure: Point and click to explore! Your character pathfinds to clicked locations, examines objects for clues, collects items to your inventory, and solves environmental puzzles to progress!
gameType.default: Basic but fun gameplay! Move your character, interact with the environment, collect items, and avoid obstacles. All the fundamentals are working!

options.text: This plays great! On to the ending

guidedGameplayTest.speaker: Pixel
guidedGameplayTest.text: Take your time! Test out all the mechanics. When you're ready, we'll move on to creating your ending screen.

guidedEndScreen.speaker: Pixel
guidedEndScreen.text: Final piece - the ending! Every great game needs a satisfying conclusion, whether you win or lose.

gameType.platformer: Victory celebration! Confetti rains down, your score displays with coin bonus, time taken shows for speedrunners, and a 'New Game+' option appears with harder levels!
gameType.rpg: Quest complete! A grand scroll unfurls showing your journey stats - monsters slain, quests completed, gold earned, experience gained. Your hero stands triumphant!
gameType.dungeon: Treasure chamber reached! Gold coins spill everywhere, rare artifacts you collected display prominently, dungeon completion percentage shows, and mysterious 'Deeper Dungeon?' option teases more!
gameType.racing: Championship podium! You stand with a trophy as confetti flies, lap times display with records highlighted, rival positions show, and 'Next Circuit' unlocks!
gameType.puzzle: Puzzle mastered! Fireworks explode in patterns, final score with combo multipliers tallied, brain rating calculated, and next puzzle set unlocks!
gameType.adventure: Journey's end! Story epilogue plays out, showing consequences of your choices, items you collected displayed like trophies, and 'New Adventure' beckons!
gameType.default: Game complete! Your final score in big numbers, achievements you unlocked listed, statistics tracked, and options to play again or return to menu!

guidedComplete.speaker: Pixel
guidedComplete.text: 🎉 CONGRATULATIONS! You've built a COMPLETE game! Title screen ✓ Gameplay ✓ Ending ✓ Everything connects perfectly!
guidedComplete.followUp: Want to see your masterpiece in action? I can show you the full experience from start to finish!

options.text: Show me the Python code behind it

learnPath.speaker: Pixel
learnPath.text: Smart choice! Python's like the secret language of games - once you know it, you can make anything!
learnPath.followUp: I've got 10 super fun lessons lined up. We'll start simple and before you know it, you'll be making actual games!

options.text: Let's start from the very beginning!
What will I learn? Show me everything!
Actually, I might know some of this already...

lessonMenu.speaker: Pixel
lessonMenu.text: Here's my full curriculum! Each lesson is like unlocking a new power-up! 🎮
lessonMenu.followUp: Where do you want to start your journey?

options.text: How do I make my game make decisions?
Actually, let me think about this

lessonMenuPage2.speaker: Pixel
lessonMenuPage2.text: More Python powers await! These lessons get into the really fun stuff!

lessonMenuPage3.speaker: Pixel
lessonMenuPage3.text: The final lessons - where Python becomes PyGame! 🚀
lessonMenuPage3.followUp: These teach you actual game development!

lessonSkillCheck.speaker: Pixel
lessonSkillCheck.text: No problem! Let's figure out where you're at so we don't waste your time!
lessonSkillCheck.followUp: Quick check - what can you already do in Python?

options.text: I can make variables and do some math
If statements and loops? Yeah, I got those
I'm basically a Python ninja already
You know what? Let's just start fresh

suggestLesson3.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson3.text: Sweet! You've got the basics down. How about we jump into making your code think?
suggestLesson3.followUp: Lesson 3 is all about decisions - like 'if the player hits a wall, bounce them back!' Super important for games!

suggestLesson5.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson5.text: Oh nice! You're past the beginner stuff. Time for the good parts!
suggestLesson5.followUp: Lists are like... imagine your game inventory, or tracking all the enemies on screen. Essential stuff!

suggestLesson7.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson7.text: Whoa, look at you! You're ready for the advanced stuff!
suggestLesson7.followUp: Dictionaries are like cheat sheets for your game - storing player stats, item properties, all that good data!

suggestLesson9.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson9.text: A Python ninja! You're totally ready for the real game development!
suggestLesson9.followUp: Want to dive straight into PyGame? Or go all-in and build something right now?

lessonComplete.speaker: Pixel
lessonComplete.followUp: What would you like to do next?

2.text: Try making a game with math!

9.text: Continue to Lesson 10 - Build a Game!

error.text: Uh oh! Something went a bit sideways there. No worries though, happens to the best of us!
